      getter method for findShortestPath

      checks if player is on an EntranceCell which matches the targetBuildingChar
      (package private) boolean inBounds(Cell[][] grid, int r, int c)
      returns true if row r and col c are valid indexes of grid
      void moveFriendCellPositions()
      updates all FriendCell positions FriendCell will not update if it is next to the PlayerCell; mimics interaction / talking
      void movePlayerDown()
      moves player down if moving down is within the grid and the cell below is traversable
      void movePlayerLeft()
      moves player left if moving left is within the grid and the cell to the left is traversable
      void movePlayerRight()
      moves player right if moving right is within the grid and the cell to the right is traversable
      void movePlayerUp()
      moves player up if moving up is within the grid and the cell above is traversable
      boolean playerHasMoved() 
      boolean playerIsBlocked()
      check if player is blocked in all 4 cardinal directions
      void readData(java.lang.String filename, Cell[][] gameData)
      fills gameData with Cell types which are specified through the characters in filename
      private void setAdjBuildingCellChars(char entranceCh, int r, int c)
      helper method for setBuildingCellCharsToMatchEntranceCellChars to dfs and set BuildingCell buildingChar to EntranceCell buildingChar
      private void setBuildingCellCharsToMatchEntranceCellChars()
      set BuildingCell buildingChar to match EntranceCell buildingChar
      void setPlayerLoc(int r, int c)
      sets player location to row r and col c if row r and col c are valid indexes in grid and grid[r][c] is a traversable cell
      void setRandomAdjFriendToPathCell()
      changes one random FriendCell that is adjacent to player to a PathCell

        creates new Grid with default size 20 by 20

      • Grid

        public Grid(int height,
            int width,
            java.lang.String filename)
        creates new grid from filename
        Parameters:
        height - the row length of grid
        width - the col length of grid
        filename - populates grid with specific Cell based on filename characters

      • setAdjBuildingCellChars

        private void setAdjBuildingCellChars(char entranceCh,
                                     int r,
                                     int c)
        helper method for setBuildingCellCharsToMatchEntranceCellChars to dfs and set BuildingCell buildingChar to EntranceCell buildingChar
        Parameters:
        entranceCh - EntranceCell buildingChar
        r - row index in grid
        c - column index in grid

      • generateFriendCells

        public void generateFriendCells(double freq)
        randomly turns PathCell into FriendCell based on frequency freq
        Parameters:
        freq - a double which correlates with the chance of a PathCell turning into a FriendCell ex. 0.25 means a PathCell has a 25% chance of turning into a FriendCell

      • moveFriendCellPositions

        public void moveFriendCellPositions()
        updates all FriendCell positions FriendCell will not update if it is next to the PlayerCell; mimics interaction / talking

      • playerIsBlocked

        public boolean playerIsBlocked()
        check if player is blocked in all 4 cardinal directions
        Returns:
        returns true if player is blocked

      • setRandomAdjFriendToPathCell

        public void setRandomAdjFriendToPathCell()
        changes one random FriendCell that is adjacent to player to a PathCell

      • hasReachedBuilding

        public boolean hasReachedBuilding(char targetBuildingChar)
        checks if player is on an EntranceCell which matches the targetBuildingChar
        Parameters:
        targetBuildingChar - the target building char
        Returns:
        returns true is cellUnderPlayer is an EntranceCell and it has the same buildingChar as targetBuildingChar

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                 float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        draws grid
        Parameters:
        marker - PApplet marker
        x - x-cord of upper left corner
        y - y-cord of upper left corner
        width - width of whole grid
        height - height of whole grid

      • getShortestPath

        int getShortestPath(int startingRow,
                    int startingCol,
                    char targetEntranceCellBuildingChar)
        getter method for findShortestPath
        Parameters:
        startingRow - starting row position in grid
        startingCol - starting col position in grid
        targetEntranceCellBuildingChar - target entrance cell building char
        Returns:
        returns shortest path move count

      • findShortestPath

        private int findShortestPath(Cell[][] grid,
                             int[] startPos,
                             char targetEntranceCellBuildingChar)
        finds shortest path via BFS
        Parameters:
        grid - Cell grid
        startPos - starting position
        targetEntranceCellBuildingChar - target entrance building char
        Returns:
        returns shortest path move count

      • inBounds

        boolean inBounds(Cell[][] grid,
                 int r,
                 int c)
        returns true if row r and col c are valid indexes of grid
        Parameters:
        grid - grid of Cells
        r - row index
        c - col index
        Returns:
        returns true if r and c are valid indexes of grid, returns false otherwise

      • setPlayerLoc

        public void setPlayerLoc(int r,
                         int c)
        sets player location to row r and col c if row r and col c are valid indexes in grid and grid[r][c] is a traversable cell
        Parameters:
        r - row index
        c - col index

      • movePlayerUp

        public void movePlayerUp()
        moves player up if moving up is within the grid and the cell above is traversable

        moves player down if moving down is within the grid and the cell below is traversable

        moves player left if moving left is within the grid and the cell to the left is traversable

      • movePlayerRight

        public void movePlayerRight()
        moves player right if moving right is within the grid and the cell to the right is traversable

      • readData

        public void readData(java.lang.String filename,
                     Cell[][] gameData)
        fills gameData with Cell types which are specified through the characters in filename
        Parameters:
        filename - String that contains characters which determine Cell type
        gameData - 2D grid of cells
